I'm not selling for Garmin, but the StreetPilot is one of the handiest devices I have seen in a long time. I recently purchased one and took off on a 1200 mile trip from Atlanta to Boston. That little dude told me (in a sexy female way) every turn and "bare-off" to take from door to door. Just key in the desired street address and follow the purple line. The map detail is amazing compared to what I had in the Lowrance and it will show the map flat or in 3D.
 
 ...well worth the six C notes I paid for it.
 
 Incidently, for the first and last time in my 50 or so years of driving, I drove 1200 miles in 24 hours...non-stop, except for a 10 minute "eye resting" at a Pennsylvania Rest Stop.

post_info.post_title: StreetPilot worth its weight in gold!

I'm not selling for Garmin, but the StreetPilot is one of the handiest devices I have seen in a long time. I recently purchased one and took off on a 1200 mile trip from Atlanta to Boston. That little dude told me (in a sexy female way) every turn and "bare-off" to take from door to door. Just key in the desired street address and follow the purple line. The map detail is amazing compared to what I had in the Lowrance and it will show the map flat or in 3D.
 
 ...well worth the six C notes I paid for it.
 
 Incidently, for the first and last time in my 50 or so years of driving, I drove 1200 miles in 24 hours...non-stop, except for a 10 minute "eye resting" at a Pennsylvania Rest Stop.

 
 
 Damn! I get white line fever at about 2 hours and have to stop for coffee. emoticon_wow
Doesn't anyone know how to read a map anymore?

Doesn't anyone know how to read a map anymore?
Sure! it's just easier and more convenient to have the upcoming turn instructions read to you as the map orients itself (in 3-D) track-up right before your very eyes and shows you exactly where you are at all times. It beats stopping to read a map, eliminates wondering how far it is to the next turn...and you can't get a map to calculate the shortest or the fastest route to an address.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  StreetPilot worth its weight in gold!
